newsitem.title: UK: Enterprise hits record high on Enserch deal.
newsitem.headline: Enterprise hits record high on Enserch deal.

text.p: Shares in Enterprise Oil Plc jumped more than three percent to a record high on the back of its announced oil exploration venture in the Gulf of Mexico with Enserch Exploration Inc, traders and analysts said.
A slight recovery in world oil prices and further gains in Britain's FTSE 100 share index also fuelled Enterprise's gains, they said.
At 0839 GMT, Enterprise was up 24-1/2p at 704p after registering its lifetime high of 706p. Volume was just over one million.
"The market as a whole is up already and oil prices are up very bullishly," said Shawn Reynolds, equities research analyst at Lehman Brothers. "Plus this deal, which is a great deal."
He rated the stock an "outperform" and said he was revisiting his 12-month price target of 720p.

Enserch and Enterprise said on Tuesday they agreed to a joint oil exploration venture in the deep water of the Gulf of Mexico, whereby Enterprise will pay the U.S.-based company $65 million for a 50 percent share of its deepwater portfolio.
Another $35 million payment by Enterprise is contingent on drilling successes and the announcement of commercial development.
The deal is subject to government approvals.
Other oil exploration company shares were mixed, with Lasmo Plc gaining 2-1/2p to 269-1/2p and Cairn Energy Plc slipping 6p to 475p. Hardy Oil & Gas Plc edged down 1-1/2p to 336p.

The front-month Brent crude oil contract on the International Petroleum Exchange ended Tuesday at $18.80 a barrel, up from a low of $17.32 in mid-June. Crude prices were expected to open 10-15 cents lower when trading begins on Wednesday.
